entry.title: Gooey Grilled Fruit with Coconut and Pecans
entry.content:
Prep time: 30 min • Cook time: 15 min• Yield: varies

Equipment

  • BBQ grill or a grill pan
Ingredients
  • Assorted fruit of your choosing; pineapple, peaches, nectarines, apricots, plums, pluots, and pears work very well; plan about 4 – 5 slices of fruit per person for dessert
  • ¾ cup coconut chips, toasted
  • ½ cup pecans, toasted and coarsely chopped
  • 1 to 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
Caramel Sauce
  • 1 cup coconut sugar
  • 4 tablespoons ghee or pasture raised butter
  •  ½ cup full fat coconut milk
  • Pinch salt
  • 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

Directions
  1. Prepare charcoal until the coals are white and ashy or preheat propane/gas grill to high. (Wait to heat grille pan until just before cooking if you are not grilling outside.)
  2. If you are using a pineapple, cut off the top and bottom of the pineapple. With a sharp knife, cut off the hard outside skin. It’s okay if there are still a few “eyes” left. Cut in half lengthwise. Place half pineapple face-down on the cutting board and cut in half the long way. Cut out the hard core. Cut each section into 3 to 4 slices, the long way. Stone fruit and pears can be cut into 6 to 8 wedges.
  3. For the carmel sauce, mix sugar, butter, coconut milk, and salt in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook while whisking gently for 6 to 8 minutes, until it thickens. Stir in vanilla and let cool.
  4. Brush both sides of fruit lightly with caramel sauce.
  5. Be sure the grill is very clean. Brush with coconut oil, and place fruit on grill.
  6. Depending on the fruit and how thick it was cut, grill for 1 to 2 minutes per side to mark fruit.
  7. Serve fruit with remaining caramel sauce, toasted coconut, and pecans.
Notes This caramel sauce is unbelievably delicious; however, it is very sweet and meant to be an occasional treat not an everyday go-to food. Store any leftover sauce in the refrigerator. When you are ready to use it, you can place the container in a bowl of hot water or microwave for a few seconds if it is too thick. This caramel sauce is great to swirl through homemade coconut milk ice cream, use between cake layers, or use to sweeten pies.

entry.title: Strawberry Shortcake Protein Ice Cream
entry.summary:
My homemade, protein packed version of the iconic Stawberry Shortcake ice cream bars from the ice cream truck.

More
entry.content:
Remember those iconic strawberry shortcake ice cream bars from the ice cream truck? They were my favorite!! This homemade version captures all that nostalgic magic but with a healthy twist! Made with clean ingredients and my vanilla bone broth protein for an amazing protein boost, it's your favorite childhood summer treat made nutritious.

Trust me, one bite and you'll be transported back to those perfect summer days, but now you can feel good about every spoonful - 25g protein and only 300 calories!

Serves: 1-2 Total Time: Overnight Preparation (10 minute prep time, 24 hour freeze time)

Strawberry Ice Cream:

1 cup fresh or frozen strawberries 

¼ cup coconut yogurt

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann’s Vanilla Bone Broth Protein

1 tbsp hemp hearts

½ tsp guar gum

1 tbsp granulated monkfruit, as desired for sweetness

¼ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

1 cup unsweetened coconut milk

Strawberry Shortcake Crumble:

½ cup freeze dried strawberries

¼ cup almond flour

¼ cup raw coconut flakes

5 large medjool dates

Filtered water, as needed to blend

Directions:

Creami:

Blend together all ingredients for the strawberry ice cream, and freeze in a Creami pint for 24 hours. 

Prep the shortcake crumble by processing together all of the ingredients until an even, crumbly mixture occurs. Set aside. 

Remove the creami from the freezer, rinse under hot water and run twice on lite ice cream. Once run, sprinkle on the strawberry shortcake crumble and top with a sliced strawberry. 


Note: You can make the ice cream and freeze into a loaf pan.

entry.title: Jalapeño, Orange & Mint Detox Water
entry.summary:
Swap the tequila for total body reset. Our Jalapeño Orange & Mint Detox Water pairs vitamin‑C‑rich citrus with capsaicin’s gentle metabolism kick and cooling mint, while Lemon Sips amps up electrolytes for all‑day energy and gut‑loving hydration. Sip first thing in the morning or before meals and feel the spicy‑sweet difference.

More
entry.content:
Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 2-3 hours (including steep time) (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 small jalapeño, thinly sliced and seeds removed

1 naval orange, peeled and thinly sliced 

¼ cup fresh mint leaves

1 serving Dr. Kellyann Lemon Sips

8 cups cold filtered water

Directions:

In a large pitcher, combine all ingredients and cover with filtered water. Stir well and steep for 2–3 hours, or overnight in the refrigerator for best flavor.

Serve as is once steeped, or enjoy over ice if desired!

entry.title: Layered Tropical Cooler
entry.summary:
This Layered Tropical Cooler is my go-to summer sip—cooling, collagen-packed, and perfect for anyone following my diet plans or needing a refreshing protein boost!

More
entry.content:
I created my Collagen Coolers because I wanted something refreshing, light, and still packed with the collagen your body craves—especially during the warmer months when sipping hot bone broth doesn’t always feel so appealing.

This Layered Tropical Cooler is one of my favorite summer treats. It’s fun, hydrating, and gives you that powerful protein + collagen boost to help support your gut, skin, and waistline. Whether you’re following one of my diet plans or just looking for a clean, no-sugar-added way to treat yourself, this colorful cooler checks all the boxes. It’s beauty food at its best—and it tastes like vacation in a glass.

Serves: 1 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

Mango Layer:

4 ice cubes

½ serving Dr. Kellyann’s Mango Collagen Cooler

¼ cup fresh mango chunks

½ tsp ground turmeric

Pinch black pepper

Filtered water, as needed to blend

Orange Creamsicle Layer:

½ serving Dr. Kellyann’s Orange Creamsicle Collagen Cooler

¼ cup fresh naval orange, chopped into chunks

Filtered water, as needed to blend

Piña Colanda Layer:

½ serving Dr. Kellyann’s Tropical Pina Colada Collagen Cooler

¼ cup fresh pineapple chunks

Filtered water, as needed to blend

Directions:

Blend each layer until smooth and creamy, then carefully stack them in a glass—starting with the mango layer, followed by the orange creamsicle, and finishing with the tropical piña colada on top. Use double the layers to make 2 servings.

entry.title: Watermelon & Mint Detox Water
entry.summary:
Hydrating summer detox refresher made from watermelon and aloe, and complemented with the digestive soother of fresh mint & lemon sips!

 

More
entry.content:
When the heat turns up, staying hydrated isn’t just a summer luxury — it’s a must for feeling energized, light, and vibrant. This refreshing watermelon and aloe drink is your new secret weapon for ultimate hydration and natural debloating support. Watermelon is packed with water and antioxidants, aloe water deeply hydrates and supports digestive health, and mint gives your belly that extra soothing boost. With a splash of my Lemon Sips, this recipe becomes a delicious, gut-friendly way to glow from the inside out — one sip at a time.

Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 2-3 hours (including steep time) (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

2 cups watermelon, cubed

¼ cup fresh mint leaves

1 serving Dr. Kellyann Lemon Sips

8 cups cold aloe water or plain water

Directions:

Blend ¼ cup of the cubed watermelon with 1 cup of the aloe water. Pour the mixture into a large pitcher, then add the mint leaves, Lemon Sips, and the remaining cubed watermelon along with the rest of the aloe water. Stir well, and let steep for 2–3 hours, or refrigerate overnight for the best flavor.

Serve as is once steeped, or enjoy over ice if desired!

entry.title: Lemon Sips Recipes: Summertime Favorites
entry.content:
Lemon Sip Slushy

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop Dr. Kellyann's Lemon Sips Lemon Ice
  • 1 scoop Dr. Kellyann's Complete Collagen Protein
  • Water
  • Ice

Directions:

Mix 1 scoop of Lemon Sips and 1 scoop of Complete Collagen Protein with 8-10 ounces of water. Stir until combined.

Add a big handful of ice cubes and blend until you get a slushy-like consistency. 

Optionally squeeze a fresh lime or lemon over the slushy and enjoy!

Note: For a fruity flavor, follow the same steps but add in a handful of frozen strawberries when blending. 

 

Lemon Sip Popsicles

 

Ingredients:

  • 2 scoops Dr. Kellyann's Lemon Sips Strawberry Lemon
  • Water
  • Strawberries, sliced
  • Lemon, sliced
  • Mint, optional
  • Popsicle mold

Directions:

Mix 2 scoop of lemon sips with 24 ounces of water. Stir until combined. 

Fill popsicle mold with Lemon Sip mixture and add in slices of strawberries and lemon. Optionally add fresh mint leaves into popsicle mold. 

Place the popsicles in the freezer for about 3-4 hours or until fully frozen. To make it easier to remove them you can dip the bottom of the mold in lukewarm water for about 10-20 seconds.

 

 

Lemon Sip Ice Tea Cubes


Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop Dr. Kellyann's Lemon Sips Iced Tea
  • 16 ounces water

Directions:

Mix 1 scoop of Lemon Sips into a glass of water and pour into an ice cube tray. Freeze until solid. Use Lemon Sip ice cubes in a glass of tea. Optionally garnish your ice tea with fresh lemon slices and mint.

entry.title: Red, White & Blue Layered Shake
entry.summary:
Sip back and relax by the pool or on the beach this 4th of July with this perfectly patriotic Red, White & Blue Shake! The three layers are all different flavors making this recipe absolutely delicious and it's also dairy-free!

More
entry.content:
Sip back and relax by the pool or on the beach this 4th of July with this perfectly patriotic Red, White & Blue Shake! The three layers are all different flavors making this recipe absolutely delicious and it's also dairy-free!

The Red Layer

  • ½ cup of Unsweetened Almond Milk
  • ¼ cup of Strawberries
  • ½ a frozen banana (optional)
  • ¼ cup raspberries

The White Layer

  • ½ a cup of coconut kefir
  • 1 Scoop Dr. Kellyann Bone Broth Protein Vanilla
  • Ice

The Blue Layer

  • ½ cup of coconut kefir
  • ½ a frozen banana (optional)
  • ½ a cup of blueberries
  • 1 scoop Collagen Peptides
  • 2 drops natural blue food dye, blue spirulina powder, or a natural dye

Directions:

For each layer, blend ingredients until smooth. We recommend cleaning the blender between each use so that the colors do not mix.

Freeze each layer in its own glass for at least 20-30 minutes before layering each into a glass for serving

entry.title: Patriotic Protein Parfait
entry.summary:
A quick, delicious Protein Parfait- high in protein and perfect for a late night treat or dessert at your next summer celebration.

More
entry.content:
I was craving something sweet but want to keep it high-protein, low carb, and gut-friendly. I came up with these Protein Parfaits and they ended up being the perfect treat.

Ready in 20 minutes or less, each parfait layers silky coconut yogurt boosted with my vanilla bone broth protein, a bright, tangy raspberry chia jam, and fresh blueberries for the ultimate finishing touch. It’s proof that you can whip up a beautiful, satisfying treat without spending hours in the kitchen — and without all the sugar. 

Serves: 2 Total Time: 20 minutes (10 minute prep time, 10 minute cook time)

Ingredients:

Vanilla Bone Broth Protein Yogurt Layer:

2 cups unsweetened coconut yogurt

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann Vanilla Bone Broth Protein Powder

Raspberry Chia Jam:

2 cups frozen raspberries

2 tbsp chia seeds

Juice of 1 lemon

Toppings:

Fresh blueberries

Lemon Zest

Directions:

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook the raspberries for 5–10 minutes, lightly mashing as they soften. Stir in chia seeds and lemon juice. Continue cooking on low until thickened and gel-like. Remove from heat and let cool.

In a bowl, mix the coconut yogurt with the bone broth protein powder until smooth.

To assemble, spoon the cooled raspberry chia jam into the bottom of a glass or jar. Layer with the protein yogurt mixture, then top with fresh blueberries and lemon zest. Serve and enjoy!

entry.title: Red, White & Blue Beetroot Detox Water
entry.summary:
Celebrate the 4th of July with a drink that’s as nourishing as it is beautiful. This Red, White & Blue Beetroot Detox Water is the perfect festive, hydrating, and sugar-free sip for your summer gatherings.

More
entry.content:
When it comes to summer celebrations, especially the 4th of July, most drinks are loaded with sugar or alcohol — leaving you bloated and dehydrated. But what if you could sip on something festive and functional? My Red, White & Blue Beetroot Detox Water is a gorgeous, hydrating alternative that supports your body while still making a patriotic statement. Packed with detoxifying beetroot, antioxidant-rich berries, crisp apple stars, and a refreshing splash of Lemon Sips, this infused water is the ultimate way to toast to your health and enjoy the holiday in style.

Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 2-3 hours (including steep time) (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 beetroot, juiced

1 cup fresh strawberries, sliced 

1 cup fresh blueberries 

1 fuji apple, peeled and sliced into stars

1 serving Dr. Kellyann Lemon Sips

8 cups cold filtered water

Directions:

In a large pitcher, combine all ingredients and cover with filtered water. Stir well and steep for 2–3 hours, or overnight in the refrigerator for best flavor.

Serve as is once steeped, or enjoy over ice if desired!

entry.title: All-American Paleo Cheesecake
entry.content:
ALL-AMERICAN PALEO CHEESECAKE

Pull out all the stops with a red, white and blue cheesecake for the 4th of July. Juicy ripe raspberries give us the red and luscious blueberries offer up their anthocyanin goodness and blue hue. What I love about blueberries is they have so much anti-oxidants in them, they make your blood flow beautifully and your eyes bright white.

Best of all, this cake is easy-to-make, no baking required, and completely Paleo! Cashews stand in for the cream cheese. You can make it smaller and deeper in an 8-inch pan or larger with less depth, depending on the size pan you choose. If you’re serving a large crowd, it’s easier to slice when the diameter is larger.

Prep time: 40 min active, 20 minutes inactive

Yield: 12 to 16 slices

Equipment: 8-inch or 10-inch springform pan

Ingredients 

Nut crust for an 8-inch pan

  • 1 cup almonds/hazelnuts/walnuts, use one or in any combination
  • ¾ cup dates
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt

Nut crust for a 10-inch pan

  • 2 cup almonds/hazelnuts/walnuts, use one or in any combination
  • 1 ¼ cup dates
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt

Filling

  • 4 cups raw cashews, soaked overnight
  • 1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
  • 1 scoop of Collagen Peptides 
  • 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract
  • 1 cup coconut oil, melted
  • 1 cup honey
  • 1 cup fresh raspberries
  • 1 cup fresh blueberries

Directions 

To make the crust

  1. Put nuts and salt in the food processor and pulse to a coarse meal. If dates are very hard, warm in the microwave to soften them. Coarsely chop by hand. Add to the food processor and pulse until nuts and dates are blended and you can form a small ball in your hand that sticks together.
  2. Line the bottom of the springform pan with parchment and spray the sides lightly with coconut oil. Press nut mixture firmly and evenly over the bottom of the pan. Set aside.

To make the filling

  1. The night before making the cheesecake, soak cashews in water and refrigerate. When you are ready to make the filling, drain the cashews and pour half of them in a powerful blender like a Vitamix™ or a food processor. Add lemon juice, vanilla, collagen, coconut oil, and honey and blend well. Add remaining cashews and blend until mixture is creamy and pourable.
  2. Divide mixture into 3 even portions, leaving one of the three portions in the blender/food processor. Add raspberries and thoroughly blend. Spread raspberry mixture evenly over the crust. Place the pan in the freezer for about 15 to 20 minutes until it is firm enough to spread the next layer without blending colors.
  3. While it is chilling, make the blueberry layer. Add one of the measured cheesecake portions to the blender/food processor, add blueberries, and thoroughly blend. Set aside.
  4. Remove from the freezer and add white layer, being careful not to blend colors. Place the pan in the freezer for about 15 to 20 minutes until it is firm enough to spread the next layer without blending colors.
  5. Remove pan from freezer and spread blueberry layer evenly over the white layer being careful not to blend colors.
  6. Chill cheesecake in the refrigerator at least 4 hours before cutting or in the freezer for 1 ½ to 2 hours. Carefully remove the springform collar before serving. Serve chilled. Garnish with berries and mint if desired.

entry.title: Thai Lemongrass Shrimp Ceviche
entry.summary:
This is one of my go-to summer recipes when I want something clean, cooling, and flavorful—without even touching the stove. With Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth stirred in, it’s got that feel-good flavor and an added protein punch your body will love.

More
entry.content:
Let me tell you—on a hot summer day, I want two things: to stay cool and eat something that feels like sunshine. This Shrimp Ceviche checks every box. It’s light, citrusy, and refreshing with just the right amount of zing—and the secret ingredient? A packet of my Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth. It adds a gentle warmth and protein boost that makes this no-cook dish taste like it came from a fancy beachside café.

Serves: 4 Total Time: 1 hour & 10 minutes (10 minute prep time, 1 hour rest time

Ingredients:

1 lb. shrimp, peeled, deveined and chopped

⅓ cup red onion, diced

¼ cup cilantro, chopped

⅓ cup English cucumber, finely diced 

Juice of 2 limes

¼ tsp ground black pepper

¼ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

1 ripe avocado, cubed 

1 packet Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth

Directions:

Gently toss all of the ingredients in a bowl until well combined.

Let refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to best allow all ingredients to meld together. Once rested, taste ceviche, and adjust any seasonings as desired with additional lime juice, sea salt, or pepper.

entry.title: Minty Lemon & Lime Cucumber Water
entry.summary:
This citrus-infused collagen water is my go-to summer sip—refreshing, hydrating, and packed with skin-loving ingredients like lemon, cucumber, mint, and Lemon Sips. It’s a simple way to nourish your body and glow from the inside out!

More
entry.content:
This citrus-infused collagen water is my go-to summer sip—refreshing, hydrating, and packed with skin-loving ingredients like lemon, cucumber, mint, and Lemon Sips. It’s a simple way to nourish your body and glow from the inside out!

Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 2-3 hours (including steep time) (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

2 lemons

2 limes

1 English cucumber, halved and sliced

1½ cups fresh mint leaves

1 serving Dr. Kellyann Lemon Sips

8 cups cold filtered water

Directions:

In a large pitcher, combine the juice of one lemon and one lime, then slice the remaining lemon and lime and add them to the pitcher followed by the sliced cucumber, mint leaves, and Lemon Sips. 

Pour in the filtered water to fully submerge the ingredients, then give the pitcher a good stir. Let the pitcher steep for 2-3 hours, or for optimal flavor, let steep overnight in the refrigerator. 

Serve as is once steeped, or enjoy over ice if desired!

entry.title: Birthday Protein Cake Pops
entry.summary:
Celebrate your special occasions with these Birthday Protein Cake Pops. Festive, adorable, and powered by 5g of Vanilla Bone Broth Protein each—proof you can have your cake & eat it too!

More
entry.content:
My incredible team spoiled me with these surprise Birthday Protein Cake Pops! They’re adorable, festive, and pack 5g of protein EACH thanks to my Vanilla Bone Broth Protein. Proof you can celebrate and still nourish your body. That’s how we do it around here! Yes, you can have your cake (pop) and eat it too!

Yields: 8 Bites Total Time: 40 minutes (20 minute prep time, 20 minutes freeze time

Ingredients:

Cake Pops:

½ cup unsweetened coconut yogurt, as needed for a firm dough consistency

1 cup almond flour

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann’s Vanilla Bone Broth Protein

1 tsp pure vanilla extract

White Chocolate Layer:

1 cup white chocolate

2 tsp coconut oil

Dye-free rainbow sprinkles

Directions:

Whisk together all of the ingredients for the cake pops until an even dough consistency has been achieved. Roll the dough into balls of 1” diameter, and place a cake pop stick in the center of each. 

Line the balls on a sheet of parchment paper and place to freeze for 10 minutes. 

While the bites freeze, whisk together the white chocolate and coconut oil until smooth. Dip each cake pop into the chocolate, and add a pinch of sprinkles onto each pop. Line the pops on the cake pop stand and place to freeze until the chocolate has set. 

To store, refrigerate in an airtight container.

entry.title: Bone Broth Balsamic Dressing Over A Summer Salad
entry.summary:
Upgrade your salad game with my favorite summer hack—bone broth dressing! It’s a simple way to sneak in protein, collagen, and gut support with every drizzle.

More
entry.content:
Want to know my favorite nutrition hack that instantly upgrades your salad? Add bone broth to the dressing! Not only does it boost protein and collagen, but it also adds a rich, savory depth that transforms your salad into a gut-nourishing, flavor-packed meal. This Rosemary Bone Broth Balsamic Dressing is one I reach for all summer long—it’s creamy, zesty, and pairs beautifully with crisp greens and pasture-raised chicken. Here’s how to make it...

Serves: 4 Total Time: 20 minutes (20 minute: prep time)

Rosemary Bone Broth Balsamic Dressing: 

½ cup balsamic vinegar

¼ cup raw tahini

2 tbsp Dijon mustard

Juice of 1 lemon

1 tbsp Dr. Kellyann Rosemary Bone Broth Powder

⅛ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

⅛ tsp black pepper 

Spring Salad: 

5 oz. package spring mix greens

Fresh mint leaves

4- 4oz. pasture-raised chicken breast

1 cup heirloom cherry tomatoes, halved

4 radishes, thinly sliced

1 medium English cucumber, halved and sliced

2 ripe avocados, cubed

½ cup raw sunflower seeds

Directions:

Whisk or blend together all the ingredients for the rosemary bone broth balsamic dressing until evenly smooth and creamy.

In a large salad bowl, toss together all of the ingredients for the Spring Salad, drizzling the rosemary bone broth balsamic dressing on top to serve and enjoy!

entry.title: Chilled Avocado Cucumber Soup
entry.summary:
Cool, creamy, and bursting with nutrients—this no-cook Chilled Avocado Cucumber Soup is a summer must-have. Made with gut-loving ingredients like avocado and Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth, it’s as satisfying as it is soothing.

More
entry.content:
When the summer sun is blazing, the last thing I want to do is turn on the stove. That’s why this Chilled Avocado Cucumber Soup is on repeat in my kitchen all season long. It’s creamy, cooling, and packed with gut-loving ingredients—like hydrating cucumber, healthy fats from avocado, fresh herbs, and a zesty kick from my Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth. I love that it takes just 20 minutes to whip up and gives me everything I need to feel light, satisfied, and energized… without the heat.

Serves: 4 Total Time: 15-20 minutes (15-20 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 red bell pepper, halved & finely chopped

1 English cucumber, halved & finely chopped

1 lemon, zested & juiced

1 white onion, chopped

1 garlic clove, peeled

½ ripe avocado

1 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley

1 packet Dr. Kellyann’s Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth

1 cup canned coconut milk

⅛ tsp cayenne pepper

½ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

½ tsp ground black pepper

Directions:

Simply combine all the ingredients in a blender until very smooth. You may need to stop the blender a few times to move the ingredients along with the handle of a wooden spoon. Once blended, taste, and adjust seasonings if desired with additional spices. 

Opt to serve straight after blending or for a cooler option, opt to place to refrigerate and chill for a few hours. 

To store, refrigerate in an airtight glass container.

entry.title: Matcha Protein Ice Cream
entry.summary:
This Matcha Protein Ice Cream is the perfect fusion of clean energy and gut-loving protein. Made with matcha and Dr. Kellyann’s Bone Broth Vanilla Protein, it’s your new favorite summer scoop.

More
entry.content:
If you're as obsessed with matcha as I am, you're going to fall in love with this creamy, dreamy, protein-packed treat. This Matcha Protein Ice Cream is my go-to summer indulgence—made with antioxidant-rich ceremonial grade matcha and my very own Bone Broth Vanilla Protein for a deliciously nourishing dessert that supports gut health, muscles, and glowing skin. It’s easy to make with your Ninja Creami (or a loaf pan!), and every spoonful tastes like pure, guilt-free satisfaction.

Serves: 1-2

Total Time: Overnight Preparation (10 minute prep time, 24 hour freeze time)

Ingredients:

Matcha Protein Ice Cream:

2 cups unsweetened coconut milk

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann Bone Broth Vanilla Protein Powder

1 tsp ceremonial grade matcha

½ tsp guar gum

1 tsp granulated monkfruit, as desired for sweetness

¼ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

Method:

Ninja Creami:

Blend together all ingredients for the matcha protein ice cream, and freeze in a Creami pint for 24 hours. 

Remove from the freezer, rinse under hot water and run twice on lite ice cream. Serve to enjoy!

Bread Loaf Pan:

If prepping in the bread loaf pan method, opt to swap the coconut milk out with coconut yogurt to achieve a creamier consistency. Blend together all ingredients for the matcha protein ice cream, and once blended, pour over in a lined bread loaf pan and place to freeze overnight. 

Once frozen, let thaw for a few minutes before serving, and then serve up to enjoy with an ice cream scoop.

entry.title: Pineapple Lemon Sips Spritzer
entry.summary:
Tropical vibes in a glass! This Pineapple Lemon Sip Spritzer combines tangy Lemon Sips with juicy pineapple for a bright, feel-good drink that screams summer.

More
entry.content:
Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 cup fresh pineapple, chopped into small chunks

Fresh dill

1 cup coconut water

1 serving Dr. Kellyann’s Lemon Sips

1 bottle (25 fl. oz) sparkling water

Ice cubes, to serve

Method:

Slice up the pineapple until in small chunks, and add into a large pitcher alongside all other ingredients. 

Let steep for several hours, or rest overnight in the refrigerator for even richer flavor.

Once steeped, serve over ice if desired and enjoy!

entry.title: Cucumber Lime Lemon Sips Spritzer
entry.summary:
This Cucumber Lime Lemon Sip Spritzer is crisp, cool, and oh-so-refreshing—like spa water leveled up! Perfect for poolside lounging or a midday pick-me-up.

More
entry.content:
Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 english cucumber, halved & sliced

1 lime, sliced

Fresh dill

1 serving Dr. Kellyann’s Lemon Sips

1 bottle (25 fl. oz) sparkling water

Ice cubes, to serve

Method:

Slice up the cucumber and lime, and add into a large pitcher alongside all other ingredients. 

Let steep for several hours, or rest overnight in the refrigerator for even richer flavor.

Once steeped, serve over ice if desired and enjoy!

entry.title: Berry Lemon Sips Spritzer
entry.summary:
Sweet, sparkling, and totally sippable—this Berry Lemon Sip Spritzer blends Strawberry Lemon Sips with your favorite berries for a fruity twist that’s picnic-perfect.

More
entry.content:
Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 cup fresh raspberries

1 cup fresh wild blueberries

Fresh mint leaves

1 serving Dr. Kellyann’s Lemon Sips

1 bottle (25 fl. oz) sparkling water

Ice cubes, to serve

Method:

Prep all the berries by thoroughly rinsing well.

In a large pitcher, combine all of the ingredients and let steep for several hours, or rest overnight in the refrigerator for an even richer flavor.

Once steeped, serve over ice if desired and enjoy!

entry.title: Lemon Sips Spritzers
entry.summary:
Looking for a refreshing, healthy summer drink? These easy Lemon Sip Spritzers are packed with flavor and skin benefits! With four delicious flavors to mix and match, you’ll have a go-to drink for every summer moment—from sunny brunches to sunset hangs.

More
entry.content:
Sip into summer with my top 3 Lemon Sip Spritzers! Whether you're hosting a backyard BBQ or lounging poolside, these refreshing, fruity drinks are the ultimate way to cool down—without the sugar crash. Made with my favorite Lemon Sips in crave-worthy flavors like Original, Cucumber Lime, Strawberry, and Mint, these spritzers are healthy, hydrating, and ridiculously easy to make. Let’s raise a glass to glowing skin and feel-good summer sips!

Berry Spritzer

Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 cup fresh raspberries

1 cup fresh wild blueberries

Fresh mint leaves

1 serving Dr. Kellyann’s Lemon Sips

1 bottle (25 fl. oz) sparkling water

Ice cubes, to serve

Method:

Prep all the berries by thoroughly rinsing well.

In a large pitcher, combine all of the ingredients and let steep for several hours, or rest overnight in the refrigerator for an even richer flavor.

Once steeped, serve over ice if desired and enjoy!

 

Cucumber Spritzer

Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 english cucumber, halved & sliced

1 lime, sliced

Fresh dill

1 serving Dr. Kellyann’s Lemon Sips

1 bottle (25 fl. oz) sparkling water

Ice cubes, to serve

Method:

Slice up the cucumber and lime, and add into a large pitcher alongside all other ingredients. 

Let steep for several hours, or rest overnight in the refrigerator for even richer flavor.

Once steeped, serve over ice if desired and enjoy!

 

Pineapple Spritzer


Serves: 4-6 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

1 cup fresh pineapple, chopped into small chunks

Fresh dill

1 cup coconut water

1 serving Dr. Kellyann’s Lemon Sips

1 bottle (25 fl. oz) sparkling water

Ice cubes, to serve

Method:

Slice up the pineapple until in small chunks, and add into a large pitcher alongside all other ingredients. 

Let steep for several hours, or rest overnight in the refrigerator for even richer flavor.

Once steeped, serve over ice if desired and enjoy!

entry.title: High Protein Frozen Yogurt Bark
entry.summary:
This High Protein Frozen Yogurt Bark is a refreshing, protein-packed summer treat made with coconut yogurt, berries, and my Vanilla Bone Broth Protein. Perfect for snacking and sharing!

More
entry.content:
Serves: 6 Total Time: 2 hours & 10 minutes (10 minute prep time, 2 hour freeze time)

Ingredients:

Fro-Yo Blend:

1 cup unsweetened coconut yogurt

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann’s Vanilla Bone Broth Protein

¼ cup frozen wild blueberries

½ tsp Ceylon cinnamon

Toppings:

1 cup fresh strawberries, chopped

Raw pumpkin seeds

Raw coconut chips

Directions:

Blend together all ingredients for the fro-yo blend until well mixed and smooth. 

Spread blend upon a piece of parchment paper, evenly sprinkle on all toppings, and place to freeze for 2 hours, or until hardened up enough to cut or break into bars. Serve to enjoy immediately!

To store, freeze in an airtight container.

entry.title: Instant Beef Bone Broth Pho
entry.summary:
This 10-minute Instant Beef Bone Broth Pho is a gut-loving, immune-boosting powerhouse with up to 50g of protein, all in one warm, nourishing jar.

More
entry.content:
Looking for a quick, comforting, and protein-packed meal that supports your gut and immune system? This Instant Beef Bone Broth Pho Jar is your new 10-minute go-to. Made with my Classic Beef Bone Broth, pasture-raised shredded chicken, shiitake mushrooms, garlic, and kelp noodles, this simple recipe delivers 50-60 grams of clean protein in one cozy serving. It’s the perfect weeknight dinner when you want something warm, healing, and satisfying—without spending hours in the kitchen.

Serves: 1 Total Time: 10 minutes

Ingredients:

1 serving kelp noodles 

1 cup pasture-raised chicken, cooked & shredded

½ cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced

1 spring onion, chopped

1 garlic clove, minced

1 packet Dr. Kellyann’s Classic Beef Bone Broth

1-1½ cups hot filtered water, as desired for broth flavor strength

Directions:

In a medium jar, simply add in all ingredients, pouring over the broth mixed in the hot filtered water until all ingredients are submerged. 

Let the bowl steep for 5-7 min. and then serve to enjoy!

entry.title: Iced Salted Caramel Protein Coffee
entry.summary:
Skip the sugar bomb from your local coffee shop—this Salted Caramel Protein Coffee has 0g of sugar, 21g of protein, and all the flavor. Blend, pour, go!

More
entry.content:
Okay, this is your sign to break up with your barista! Hear me out—you can make the creamiest, dreamiest Salted Caramel Protein Coffee right at home. No sugar crashes, no mystery syrups… just 0g of sugar, 21g of clean protein, and all the flavor you love. This Salted Caramel Protein Coffee is your new go-to! Made with creamy macadamia milk, a double shot of espresso, and Dr. Kellyann’s Salted Caramel Bone Broth Protein, it's the perfect way to energize your morning or power through an afternoon slump—without the crash and those caffeine jitters!

Serves: 1 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

Salted Caramel Protein Coffee: 

1 cup macadamia milk

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann’s Salted Caramel Bone Broth Protein 

Double espresso or your favorite coffee

To Serve:

Handful ice

Cinnamon

Directions:

Blend all ingredients until even and creamy. Can optionally add in 1 tbsp of raw cacao powder or nibs, if looking for a dash of chocolate!

Add ice to a glass, and pour protein coffee on top to serve! Sprinkle cinnamon on top for extra benefits!

Note: You can also make this hot! Pour in a scoop of the Salted Caramel Bone Broth Protein into your mug of coffee and use a frother to blend!

entry.title: Sriracha Bone Broth Guacamole
entry.summary:
When I head to a party and want a clean, satisfying snack, I whip up my go-to guacamole—with a spicy, protein-packed twist you’re going to love!

More
entry.content:
Serves: 4 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

3 ripe avocados, roughly mashed

½ red onion, diced

2 Roma tomatoes, diced

¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped

2 garlic cloves, minced

1 tbsp Dr. Kellyann’s Sriracha Chicken Bone Broth Powder

Juice of 1 lime

Directions:

Cut avocados in half, remove pits, and scoop flesh into a bowl. Roughly mash with a fork to desired consistency.

Fold in all other ingredients until well mixed. Taste and adjust seasoning if desired. Serve to enjoy with pairings of choice!

entry.title: Bone Broth Cauliflower Hummus
entry.summary:
A creamy, flavor-packed twist on traditional hummus with hidden veggies, warm spices, and a bone broth protein boost your body (and taste buds) will love.

More
entry.content:
Say goodbye to bland high fat, high carb dips and hello to a creamy, protein-packed upgrade your taste buds will crave! This Bone Broth Cauliflower Hummus is a secretly healthy twist on the classic, blending steamed or roasted cauliflower with zesty lemon, warm spices, and the nourishing power of Dr. Kellyann’s Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth. It's the perfect hidden-veggie recipe that delivers approximately 17 grams of protein per bactch—without sacrificing flavor. Whether you're serving it as a snack, appetizer, or party platter centerpiece, this hummus is sure to be a crowd favorite!

Serves: 4 Total Time: 30 minutes (10 minute prep time, 20 minute cook time)

Ingredients:

2 cups steamed or roasted cauliflower florets

2 tbsp raw tahini

Juice of 1 lemon

2 garlic cloves

½ tsp ground mustard seed powder

½ tsp coriander seeds

½ tsp cumin seeds

¼ tsp paprika

1 tbsp Dr. Kellyann’s Thai Lemongrass Bone Broth Powder

Toppings:

Lemon

Fresh herbs

Sunflower seeds

Sesame seems

Paprika

Directions:

Let the cauliflower fully cool once steamed or roasted, and then process alongside all other ingredients until even and creamy. Add water as desired to achieve desired consistency, and taste as desired with any additional seasonings.

Top to finish with a fresh squeeze of lemon, chopped herbs, seeds, and a sprinkle of paprika. Serve to enjoy as a veggie dip, spread on sandwiches, or just eat it off the spoon!

entry.title: Cinco De Mayo Recipe Roundup
entry.summary:
Cinco de Mayo is the perfect excuse to turn up the flavor and keep things feeling good from the inside out! Whether you're hosting a full-on fiesta or just want to spice up your weekly meal plan, these paleo-friendly recipes bring the party

More
entry.content:
Cinco de Mayo is the perfect excuse to turn up the flavor and keep things feeling good from the inside out! Whether you're hosting a full-on fiesta or just want to spice up your weekly meal plan, these paleo-friendly recipes bring the party—without the post-meal bloat.

I’ve rounded up 6 gut-loving, bone broth-boosted recipes that are perfect for a healthier Cinco celebration. From tacos to salads to cocktails, these dishes are packed with flavor, nourishing ingredients, and all the fiesta vibes. 

Ready to feel amazing and indulge a little? Let’s get cooking!

Healthy Taco Salad Recipe

Verde Tomatillo Maria

Salmon Tacos with Cabbage Slaw & Creamy Cilantro Dressing

Fiesta Beef Fajitas

Spicy Bone Broth Margarita

Mexican Chocolate Shake

entry.title: Salted Caramel Protein Bites
entry.summary:
A better way to do Easter candy—these Salted Caramel Protein Eggs are sweet, chocolatey, and full of health benefits. Your taste buds (and body) will thank you!

More
entry.content:
Easter candy is fun and festive... until the sugar crash hits. That’s why I whipped up these Salted Caramel Protein Bites. They’re chocolatey, a little salty, and totally satisfying without any refined sugar. Plus, they’ve got healthy fats and a protein boost from my NEW Salted Caramel Bone Broth Protein to keep you going. Whether you’re sneaking a treat from the fridge or swapping out your kids' candy stash, these are a holiday win. Kid-Friendly tip: Shape them into little Easter eggs!

Yields: ~30 bites Total Time: 1 hour & 15 minutes (15 minute prep time, 1 hour freeze time)

Ingredients:

Salted Caramel Protein Easter Egg Dough:

1 cup coconut flour

½ cup raw walnuts

¼ cup hemp hearts

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann’s Salted Caramel Bone Broth Protein

¼ cup raw tahini

1 tsp Ceylon cinnamon

¼ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

¼ cup filtered water, as needed to blend 

Topping:

¼ cup dark chocolate chips, refined sugar free >70% raw cacao

1 tbsp coconut oil

Flaky sea salt

Directions:

In a food processor or sturdy blender, blend all the ingredients together for the dough until a smooth consistency has been achieved. 

Roll dough into 30 small eggs, each using approximately 1½ tbsp of the dough, and line evenly on parchment paper.

Melt chocolate chips and coconut oil over low stovetop heat, and evenly drizzle melted chocolate over the eggs. Top each egg off with flaky sea salt, and place to freeze for 1 hour, or until the chocolate has fully hardened. 

To store, place to freeze in an airtight container.

Stay tuned for more recipes using my NEW favorite Bone Broth Protein Powder!

entry.title: Spring Detox Pesto
entry.content:
Serves: 4 Total Time: 20 minutes (15 minute prep time, 5 minute cook time)

Ingredients:

Rainbow Chard Pumpkin Seed Pesto:

2 cups rainbow chard leaves, leaves only, roughly chopped

1 medium Campari tomato

1 cup raw pumpkin seeds

3 garlic cloves, peeled

Juice of 1 lemon

3 tbsp apple cider vinegar, with the mother

1 tbsp coconut aminos

¼ tsp cayenne pepper

¼ tsp ground black pepper

Filtered water, as needed to blend

Kelp Noodles: 

12 oz. bag kelp noodles

2 cups dandelion greens, leaves & stem, roughly chopped

Toppings: 

Raw pumpkin seeds

Directions:

Prepare kelp noodles in a large bowl by pouring over the juice of 1 lemon, and enough warm water to fully submerge the noodles. Massage the kelp noodles well with your hands until soft. Let sit while progressing with the recipe. 

In a food processor or sturdy blender, blend together all of the ingredients for the pesto until smooth and creamy.  

Rinse and drain the kelp noodles, then add to a medium saucepan over low-medium heat. Stir in the pesto and chopped dandelion greens. Toss everything together and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the noodles are evenly coated and everything is warmed through.

Top to serve with a sprinkle of pumpkin seeds and enjoy!

entry.title: Lemon Chicken Mediterranean Salad
entry.summary:
This Lemon Chicken Mediterranean Salad is fresh, filling, and 100% compliant with my 21-Day Bone Broth Diet. It’s exactly what I’d order when dining out: clean protein, healthy fats, and vibrant veggies—all topped with a golden tahini dressing.

More
entry.content:
This Lemon Chicken Mediterranean Salad is a vibrant, nutrient-packed dish that’s completely compliant with my 21-Day Bone Broth Diet—making it a perfect choice for anyone looking to nourish their body while staying on track. It’s rich in protein, healthy fats, and anti-inflammatory ingredients like turmeric and avocado, and the flavors are just as satisfying as the benefits.

If I were dining out, I’d ask for something similar, grilled chicken over a bed of greens with cucumber, red onion, avocado, olives, and parsley—dressed in olive oil and lemon, and topped with a sprinkle of hemp hearts. Simple, clean, and totally delicious.

Serves: 4 Total Time: 55 minutes (45 minute prep time, 10 minute cook time)

Ingredients:

Lemon & Herb Chicken:

4- 4oz. pasture-raised chicken breast

2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil

Juice of 1 lemon

2 tbsp coconut aminos

3 garlic cloves, minced

1 tsp dried basil

1 tsp dried oregano

¼ tsp ground black pepper

Golden Tahini Dressing: 

¾ cup tahini

Juice of 1 lemon

1 tbsp apple cider vinegar

1 tbsp coconut aminos

½ tbsp raw honey

1 tbsp ground turmeric

¼ tsp cayenne pepper

⅛ tsp hand-harvested sea salt

⅛ tsp black pepper 

Mediterranean Salad: 

4 medium Romaine heads

1 bunch fresh parsley, chopped

1 medium English cucumber, halved and sliced

1 red onion, thinly sliced

1 large ripe avocado, cubed

½ cup Kalamata olives, halved

Hemp Hearts, sprinkle on top

Directions:

Whisk together all the ingredients for the lemon and herb chicken marinade, excluding the extra virgin olive oil. Toss the chicken breasts to coat evenly, then refrigerate to marinate for 30 minutes while continuing with the recipe, or marinate overnight for a deeper flavor.

While the chicken marinates, whisk together all the ingredients for the golden tahini dressing until smooth and creamy.

In a large salad bowl, toss together all of the ingredients for the Mediterranean salad. 

Once the chicken has marinated, heat the extra virgin olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken breasts and cook until evenly browned on both sides and fully cooked through. Once done, slice the chicken into thin strips or chunks.

To assemble, divide the salad evenly amongst bowls, top with the sliced chicken, and drizzle with the golden tahini dressing.  Finish with a generous sprinkle of hemp hearts, and enjoy!

entry.title: Vitamin C Beauty Bowl
entry.summary:
Step into a world of radiant, inner beauty with my Vitamin C Beauty Bowl—a quick, 10-minute treat designed to nourish your skin and energize your day. I believe that true beauty begins from within, and this recipe is a vibrant blend of nature’s best.

More
entry.content:
Step into a world of radiant, inner beauty with my Vitamin C Beauty Bowl—a quick, 10-minute treat designed to nourish your skin and energize your day. I believe that true beauty begins from within, and this recipe is a vibrant blend of nature’s best.

Packed with vitamin C and collagen-boosting ingredients, this bowl features tropical pineapple, creamy coconut yogurt, and a powerful dose of camu camu powder—one teaspoon alone delivers about 182 mg of vitamin C, making the total vitamin C content of this bowl around 260 mg! Add in a scoop of collagen peptides to support skin elasticity, and you've got a true beauty-boosting powerhouse. Finished with fresh pineapple, juicy strawberries, crunchy coconut chips, and nutrient-dense pumpkin seeds, this bowl is as delicious as it is skin-loving. Enjoy every spoonful knowing you're fueling your glow from the inside out!

 

Serves: 1 Total Time: 10 minutes (10 minute prep time)

Ingredients:

Smoothie Bowl:

1 cup frozen pineapple chunks

1 frozen banana

1 cup unsweetened coconut yogurt

1 tsp. camu camu powder

1 scoop Dr. Kellyann's Collagen Peptides

Toppings:

Fresh pineapple, sliced

Fresh strawberries 

1 tbsp raw coconut chips

1 tbsp raw pumpkin seeds

Directions:

Blend all smoothie ingredients until even and creamy. Smooth over in a bowl and finish off with your favorite toppings! Enjoy!
